description: The singer, 36, cut a pretty figure in a polka dot ensemble but it was her fun-loving arm candy that had turned heads as she left the Coliseum Theatre in London late Tuesday evening.
title: Katherine Jenkins steps out with quirky lip handbag
title_page: Katherine Jenkins steps out with quirky lip handbag | Daily Mail Online
text:
She is currently taking to the stage as Julie Jordan in the new West End show of Carousel.
And wrapping up yet another successful night, Katherine Jenkins made sure all eyes were on her as she left the Coliseum Theatre in London late Tuesday evening.
The singer, 36, cut a pretty figure in a polka dot ensemble but it was her fun-loving arm candy that had turned heads.
Scroll down for video
Making a statement: Katherine Jenkins turned heads on her exit from the Coliseum Theatre on Tuesday night following another performance in Carousel
Katherine toted her evening essentials in a mini red leather bag that featured a gold buckle in the shape of a pair of lips.
She wore her accessory over one shoulder and made sure to match her own mouth to that on her bag as she added a slick of Hollywood red lipstick to her lips.
Slipping out of her stage costume and into a much more stylish ensemble, Katherine teamed together a polka dot blouse and neck tie.
Pretty in polka dots: The singer cut a pretty figure in her monochrome ensemble but it was her fun-loving arm candy that stole the show
Stylish accessory: Her bag featured a gold clasp in the shape of a pair of lips that made for an eye-catching display
Bold look: Katherine teamed her statement handbag with a slick of Hollywood red lipstick on her own lips
She wore a pair of form-fitting leggings that highlighted her enviable pins and added some height to her ensemble with a pair of suede heels on her feet.
Her blonde tresses were swept over to one side in a voluminous style and paired with flawlessly applied make-up.
Katherine appeared to be in high spirits as she left the theatre and gave a wave to audience members who had been waiting for her by the stage door, before signing autographs.
Meet and greet: She was more than happy to stop for audience members and sign autographs on her exit
Glam appearance: Katherine gave theatre-goers a wave as she headed home after taking to the stage once again
Katherine is currently starring in the English National Opera's production of Rodgers & Hammerstein's Carousel, alongside theatre star Alfie Boe.
The classic musical tells the tale of carousel barker Billy Bigelow, played by Alfie, who falls in love with mill-worker Julie Jordan, played by Katherine.
The show marks Katherine's first ever acting role and she has won praise from critics following her debut - even if the thought of getting up on stage had 'terrified her'.
First acting role: She is currently starring as Julie Jordan in the new West End show of Carousel
Speaking to the Evening Standard about her new role, she said: 'I’ve been doing a lot of work for the last two months privately to prepare myself for this day, from acting coaches to music coaches.
'I set up a schedule of my own so some mornings I would have my coach come over and run through some of the music and for the rest of the day I would just be in such a good mood and I honestly think it’s the music.
'I really think if people come that is the instant takeaway from this, it’s just such a fantastic score.'
